Line 38: Line 38:
==ISZ format==
==ISZ format==
â
UltraISO uses a proprietary format known as ISZ. The format advertised as "ISO Zipped", even though it is not a simple zip archive. The format uses ZLIB or BZIP2 to compress the data, and can support [[Advanced Encryption Standard|AES]] encryption of various strength. The file format specification is available publicly on EZB Systems's website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ezbsystems.com/isz/iszspec.txt|title=ISZ File Format Specification|date=2006-07-03|publisher=EZB Systems|accessdate=2008-09-24}}</ref> The format is now supported by third party applications such as [[Daemon Tools]].
+
UltraISO uses a proprietary and non-documented format known as ISZ. The format advertised as "ISO Zipped", even though it is not a simple zip archive. The format uses ZLIB or BZIP2 to compress the data, and can support [[Advanced Encryption Standard|AES]] encryption of various strength. The file format specification is available publicly on EZB Systems's website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ezbsystems.com/isz/iszspec.txt|title=ISZ File Format Specification|date=2006-07-03|publisher=EZB Systems|accessdate=2008-09-24}}</ref> The format is now supported by third party applications such as [[Daemon Tools]].
